description:
Calling nova-manage like: "nova-manage user a"  displays the following

----8<----

Possible wrong number of arguments supplied
user admin: creates a new admin and prints exports
        arguments: name [access] [secret]
2011-02-04 09:41:49,070 CRITICAL nova.root [-] admin() takes at least 2 arguments (1 given)
(nova.root): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.root): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 694, in <module>
(nova.root): TRACE:     main()
(nova.root): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 686, in main
(nova.root): TRACE:     fn(*argv)
(nova.root): TRACE: TypeError: admin() takes at least 2 arguments (1 given)
(nova.root): TRACE:

---->8----

maybe only cosmetic, the "a" is interpreted as "admin".
title: nova-manage with param 'user a' results in traceback

comments.content:
Calling nova-manage like: "nova-manage user a"  displays the following

----8<----

Possible wrong number of arguments supplied
user admin: creates a new admin and prints exports
        arguments: name [access] [secret]
2011-02-04 09:41:49,070 CRITICAL nova.root [-] admin() takes at least 2 arguments (1 given)
(nova.root): TRACE: Traceback (most recent call last):
(nova.root): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 694, in <module>
(nova.root): TRACE:     main()
(nova.root): TRACE:   File "/usr/bin/nova-manage", line 686, in main
(nova.root): TRACE:     fn(*argv)
(nova.root): TRACE: TypeError: admin() takes at least 2 arguments (1 given)
(nova.root): TRACE:

---->8----

maybe only cosmetic, the "a" is interpreted as "admin".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~naehring

comments.content: this is operating correctly, nova-manage does a lazy-match on the first & second argument (as it must be a category and action) ... if we don't like the stack-trace, we can comment nova-manage:691 (the raise call).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ken-pepple

comments.content: I think the stack trace should only be displayed while running in the debug mode.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~berendt

comments.content: i think this assumes that we have a debug mode :)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ken-pepple

comments.content: Closing as expected behavior. nova-manage is a bit raw :)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
